name: Mini Honey Infused Hair Oil
categories: Hair, Hair Styling & Treatments, Hair Oil
about: What it is: A bestselling, award-winning & clinically proven hair oil powered by Mirsalehi Honey to intensely hydrate, instantly boost shine and smooth frizz..Hair Type: Fine, Medium, and Thick.Hair Texture: Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily.Hair Concerns:.- Dryness.- Frizz.- Shine.Key Benefits:.- Instantly hydrates & boosts shine.- Smooths frizz and flyaways.- Protects up to 450°F/ 230°C.Highlighted Ingredients:.- Mirsalehi Honey: Delivers long-lasting hydration & boosts shine..- Bee Garnde Oils: Deeply nourishes, locks in moisture, and smooths frizz..Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also gluten-free and cruelty-free..What Else You Need to Know: This bestselling & clinically proven hair oil is powered by Mirsalehi Honey - a powerful natural humectant sustainably sourced from Gisou's own Bee Garden - to intensely hydrate, instantly boost shine & smooth frizz, along with a Bee Garden Oil Blend that deeply nourishes for glossy hair..Clinical Results:.Clinically proven*.- +143% Instant Shine.- 72H Hydration.- 72H Frizz & Humidity Control.- Up to 450°F/230°C Heat Protection.*Based on an independent lab study using scientifically proven instrumental testing.Fragrance Description: Delicate, sweet notes of our unique Mirsalehi Honey sourced from our Bee Garden, bring a luxurious & sensorial fragrance..This one-of-a-kind, indulgent scent evokes Gisou’s rich heritage, rooted in nature and centered around six generations of beekeeping...This product is an Allure Best of Beauty award winner...CLEAN at Sephora is our commitment to offering formulas that go beyond regulatory standards to avoid controversial ingredients without sacrificing on effectiveness.
ingredients: -Mirsalehi Honey: A natural humectant that attracts and retains moisture for stronger, healthier, shinier hair..-Coconut Oil: Conditions and tames frizz while adding luster and shine. .-Almond Oil: Protects, strengthens, and moisturizes..  .Dimethicone, Dimethiconol, Trisiloxane, Mirsalehi Honey, Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Argania Spinosa Kernel Oil, Passiflora Incarnata Seed Oil, Tocopheryl Acetate, Parfum (Fragrance), Gardenia Taitensis Flower Extract, CI 47000 (Yellow 11), Tocopherol, CI 26100 (Red 17), Coumarin, Hexyl Cinnamal, Limonene, Linalool. ....The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.As a finishing touch:.- Apply a few drops into your palms and rub your hands together until the product is dispersed throughout your palms and fingers..- Use your fingers in a combing motion to evenly distribute the product from mid-lengths to ends, after styling on dry hair....PRO TIPS:.As a moisture boost:.-Mix a few drops with the Gisou Honey Infused Hair Mask (sold separately) for an extra moisture..-Mix well in hands and apply to towel-dried hair from root to tip..-Leave in for five to seven minutes, then rinse thoroughly....As an overnight treatment:.-Coat dry hair with two full droppers, adding more as needed for length and thickness..-Fine and oily hair types should use one full dropper and focus on the ends..-If the product isn’t fully absorbed in the morning, lightly rinse and shampoo.

reviews.review_text: The Gisou Honey Infused Hair Oil comes in a sleek, compact bottle that’s perfect for on-the-go use. It spread easily and absorbed quickly, leaving my hair feeling soft and nourished without any greasy residue. For styling, I also used it on dry hair to tame flyaways and add shine. It worked well in small amounts, enhancing the overall smoothness and manageability of my hair. Given my dry and frizzy hair, the Gisou Honey Infused Hair Oil provided excellent hydration and frizz control. It made my curls more defined and added a healthy shine. Over several weeks of regular use, I noticed my hair becoming softer and more manageable. The oil seemed to improve the overall health of my hair, reducing split ends and breakage. It also helped maintain moisture, which is crucial for my dry hair type. Use it as a pre-shampoo treatment, leave-in conditioner, or styling aid. It’s versatile and works well in different roles. The Gisou Honey Infused Hair Oil Travel Size is a fantastic product for those with dry, frizzy hair looking for a lightweight, nourishing oil. Its pleasant scent, easy application, and noticeable long-term benefits make it worth considering.

It also smells so heavenly, and I love it so much. I literally only have one problem. The bottle leaks. While the packaging and bottle look so cute and pretty, for some reason, the bottle leaks whenever I use it. That's the only con. I swear this product is great. If Gisou changed the packaging so that it doesn't leak, it would be so amazing. The sales would skyrocket from me alone! I genuinely wish the bottle didn't leak since the actual hair oil itself is just so beautiful and works like magic!

This Honey infused hair oil is amazing. I loved how it made my hair look shiny and healthy without making it look greasy or dirty. I also like that you dont have to use much of the product to make your hair look good.

reviews.review_text: The product smells amazing! However, it did come with some constraints. First of all, when I applied it to my hair, it left it very greasy. I touched my hair and it left my hands extremely greasy and it wouldn’t come of my hands. I tried scrubbing it with soap and using hot water, but nothing came off. Next, when I put the applicator back in the bottle, some of the product spilt out of the bottle, leaving the bottle to be very greasy and it just wouldn’t come off the bottle. I scrubbed and scrubbed and when it finally came off, I put it in my vanity and left for a couple of hours. When I came back to it, it very very greasy again, and I had realized that the bottl had leaked all over my drawer. I was not only furious, but I had to spend over 30 minutes scrubbing the drawer hoping it would come off. Now my vanity is all greasy and it still will not come off.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: For context I have fine hair that’s been dyed in the past few months so my ends tend to be a bit dry and in need of moisture. I received the Honey Infused Hair Oil today and my first impression is that I absolutely love it. The smell is slightly sweet but not overpowering, perfectly balanced, and the texture is nice and thick, just like honey but not sticky at all, and easy to work through my hair. Typically hair oil is meant for those prone to more dry than oily hair, but as someone who tends to have an oily scalp and dry ends this is an absolute blessing. I only used 3-4 drops and it was the perfect amount to moisturize my ends without being overly saturated. However, I’m sure those with thicker and more textured hair will also love this product as it’s deeply moisturizing. When I first applied the hair oil it immediately made my hair feel incredibly soft and 8-10 hours later my hair feels the exact same. This product made me want to keep running my fingers through my hair! If you’re someone with hair on the thinner side and have found other products make your hair and scalp weighed down by oil I would highly recommend giving the Honey Infused Hair Oil a try. This formula is so versatile and again, if you’re particularly sensitive to added fragrance this is a perfect choice for gentle and effective hair care. I can’t wait to see the results using this over a longer period but from the first time I applied this I was in love. This is the first product I’ve tried from Gisou and it left such a great impression that I definitely want to their other products in the future.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: As someone with long, thick hair that's prone to frizz and dryness, finding a product that truly nourishes without weighing it down has proven to be difficult. Gisou's Honey Infused Hair Oil not only met but exceeded my expectations.  Firstly, the scent is amazing. It's a subtle blend of honey with floral undertones that linger throughout the day without being overpowering. The texture of the oil is luxurious yet lightweight, making it easy to distribute evenly through damp or dry hair.  What really sets this product apart is its effectiveness. After just a few uses, my hair feels noticeably softer and more manageable. The oil absorbs quickly, leaving no greasy residue, which is a huge plus for someone like me who styles their hair daily. It tames flyaways and adds a nice, natural shine that lasts.  I also appreciate the natural ingredients Gisou incorporates into their products. Knowing that it's formulated without sulfates, parabens, or silicones gives me confidence that I'm using something that's not only good for my hair but also sustainable.  Overall, Gisou's Honey Infused Hair Oil has become a staple in my hair care routine. It's a luxurious treat that delivers real results, making my hair look and feel healthier with each use. If you're looking for a high-quality hair oil that nourishes and enhances your hair's natural beauty, look no further than Gisou.

reviews.review_title: Actually does something for my hair
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really like this oil as far as how it performs in my dry, frizzy, multi-textured hair.  For reference, it is hip-length, mostly fine wavy/curly but my grays are super wiry, coarse and kinky.  They stick out all over my head and it look terrible.   I don't know whether my hair is high or low porosity because nothing I've tried makes any difference (and I've tried EVERYTHING) to smooth out and moisturize it.  But anyway, Gisou hair oil actually does impart some shine and smoothness for me.  It's the only hair oil I've tried that doesn't immediately soak in and disappear, so I feel like it's actually doing something.  It is very heavy, so I wouldn't recommend for very fine or thin hair unless you use the tiniest amount and keep it far away from the roots.   For my dry unmanageable hair, it's great.  However, I HATE the dropper top.  It is sooooo messy.  Like other reviewers, no matter how careful I am, the product gets on the outside of the bottle and makes it slippery af.  8 feel like I'm wasting a lot of expensive product.   They need to rethink the packaging and switch to a closed pump bottle.
